elements.text:
Your boss tells everyone that tomorrow you'll divide into small groups to plan out new work projects. They also say that you'll have to pick your group, but you realize you don't have any close friends in your workplace.

Here are some thoughts that might pop into mind:

texts: People might disagree with my ideas, but I think we'll still have an interesting discussion.
No one will want to be in my group.
There are lots of nice people in my workplace.
I'll find the right group for me.
Everyone will decide they want to be with people they already know, but I understand that.
